subject: Baseball
Right-Handedness
lead_paragraph: ¶The Mets avoided arbitration with the right-hander John Maine, agreeing to a one-year contract worth $2.6 million. Maine, who made $450,000 in 2008, was eligible for arbitration for the first time. Maine went 10-8 with a 4.18 earned run average in 25 starts last season. ... The Yankees and Brian Bruney avoided arbitration by agreeing to a one-year, $1.25 million deal. Bruney, who went 3-0 in 32 appearances, was the Yankees’ final arbitration-eligible player.
